title: Dual Package Setup
description: Create a package.json with conditional exports that supports both ESM and CommonJS consumers.
instructions:
Create a package.json for a library called 'my-utils' that:
1. Has type: 'module' (ESM by default)
2. Uses the exports field with conditional exports
3. Points ESM consumers (import) to './dist/index.mjs'
4. Points CJS consumers (require) to './dist/index.cjs'
5. Points TypeScript (types) to './dist/index.d.ts'
6. Also exports a './helpers' subpath with the same pattern

testCases.description: Has exports field with import condition
Has exports field with require condition

hints.text: The exports field uses "." for the main entry and "./subpath" for subpaths
Each export should have 'types', 'import', and 'require' conditions in that order

commonMistakes.consequence: TypeScript types may not be found or wrong module format used
commonMistakes.correction: Order should be: types, import, require (or types first, then more specific to less specific)

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing the dot in main export path
commonMistakes.consequence: Main entry point not properly defined
commonMistakes.correction: Use "." for the main entry, not "" or "index"
